onset.Description: Onset of clip relative to full film file

Strong.Instructions: Move the gauge up as you feel strong. Move it down as you feel weak. You may use the middle of the scale to indicate feeling neither particularly strong nor weak.

Love.Instructions: Love is a strong feeling of liking some people very much and being attached to them. For example, you may experience love when you like a person, a child, or a lover very much. Move the gauge up as you feel more love. Move it down as you feel less love.

GoalsOther.Description: It was important and relevant for the goals or needs of somebody
GoalsOther.Instructions: Important and relevant for the goals or needs of somebody is a situation that will help somebody achieve their wants and needs. Move the gauge up in situations that are important and relevant for somebodys goals and down for situations that are irrelevant. If you find conflict with different characters in the movie focus on the character you feel most invested in.

Good.Instructions: Move the gauge up as you feel good. Move it down as you feel less good.

Guilt.Instructions: Guilt is the response when a person regrets having violated agreements, principles, or values. For example, you may experience guilt when some behaviours or situations violate your own values or moral code. Move the gauge up as you feel guity. Move it down as you feel less guilty.
